items.title: Archiving utility.
items.subtitle: Often combined with a compression method, such as gzip or bzip2.

items.title: tar cf path/to/target.tar path/to/file1 path/to/file2 ...
items.subtitle: [c]reate an archive and write it to a [f]ile:

items.title: tar czf path/to/target.tar.gz path/to/file1 path/to/file2 ...
items.subtitle: [c]reate a g[z]ipped archive and write it to a [f]ile:

items.title: tar czf path/to/target.tar.gz --directory=path/to/directory .
items.subtitle: [c]reate a g[z]ipped archive from a directory using relative paths:

items.title: tar xvf path/to/source.tar[.gz|.bz2|.xz]
items.subtitle: E[x]tract a (compressed) archive [f]ile into the current directory [v]erbosely:

items.title: tar xf path/to/source.tar[.gz|.bz2|.xz] --directory=path/to/directory
items.subtitle: E[x]tract a (compressed) archive [f]ile into the target directory:

items.title: tar caf path/to/target.tar.xz path/to/file1 path/to/file2 ...
items.subtitle: [c]reate a compressed archive and write it to a [f]ile, using [a]rchive suffix to determine the compression program:

items.title: tar tvf path/to/source.tar
items.subtitle: Lis[t] the contents of a tar [f]ile [v]erbosely:

items.title: tar xf path/to/source.tar --wildcards "*.html"
items.subtitle: E[x]tract files matching a pattern from an archive [f]ile:
